MADICES 1 workshop (2022), co-organised by us
MADICES 2 workshop (Berlin, April 2024), plus 3 online pre-meetings
BIG-MAP EUnified Battery Data Space workshop, Grindelwald, Switzerland (February 2024)
Workshop: FAIR and Open Data in NFFA-Europe Pilot and Beyond, Maier-Leibnitz Zentrum, Germany (Sep 2023)
Workshop: NCCR Network Ventures - Open Research Data events, Basel, Switzerland (June 2023)
A guide to ontologizing metadata - video discussing benefits/challenges and guidelines/best practices.
openBIS-AiiDAlab interoperability - video demonstrating the current state of data interoperability between openBIS ELN and AiiDAlab.
Platform-agnostic ORD interoperability - video presenting concept/demo of new data transfer protocol using JSON-LD and RO-Crate.
openBIS imaging technology plugin - video demonstrating new plugin for modeling 1D/2D datasets visually in ELN.
AiiDAlab-Aurora: Model UI for digital twins - video demonstrating UI for managing, preparing, submitting, and analyzing battery cycling experiments as part of automated platform.

Operando observation of (Bi)carbonate precipitation during electrochemical CO₂ reduction in strongly acidic electrolytes. This paper provides experimental evidence that high local pH near the catalyst can lead to these issues, suggesting that sufficiently large current densities are needed to maintain high selectivity in acidic environments.

A bridge between trust and control: Computational workflows meet automated battery cycling. This paper discusses the first-ever integration of a workflow manager system (AiiDA) with an autonomous battery assembly/cycling platform (Aurora).

How to verify the precision of density-functional-theory implementations via reproducible and universal workflows. This paper provides an expert recommendation on how to verify the numerical correctness, or precision, of simulations performed at the DFT level. This paper both constitutes an important milestone for error estimation of simulations, and demonstrates the use of 11 different simulation codes interoperably, with the same input and outputs across them.

Developments and applications of the OPTIMADE API for materials discovery, design, and data exchange. This paper discusses the recent advances of the OPTIMADE API, a REST API to provide access to crystal structure data from tens of different database online, both from simulations and from experiments, enabling interoperability of experimental and simulation data in the domain of material science.

The Wannier-Functions Software Ecosystem for Materials Simulations. This review discusses the interoperability of softwares used to simulate materials properties leveraging Wannier functions, and formalizes the existence of an ecosystem of interoperable codes.

Innovating the batteries of the future. Overview of research activities at Empa's laboratory Materials for Energy Conversion including Aurora/AiiDA/OpenBIS (multiple talks: EPFL IMX Seminar, Upcell Alliance Webinar, ETH D-ITET Faculty Lunch, SATW/SWISSMEM Tag der Technik, Wirtschaftscluster Energie Lunch, Swiss Chemical Society 1st Swiss Symposium on Materials Chemistry, BASF seminar).
Towards an autonomous robotic battery innovation platform. An overview and demonstration of the Aurora project. (BIG-MAP EUnified Battery Data Space workshop, Feb 2024).

Driving Robotic Battery Experiment Workflows with AiiDA. A poster highlighting the integration of the AiiDA WFMS with the Aurora battery assembly and cycling platform at Empa. (Swiss Battery Days 2023)

The Aurora project - towards an autonomous robotic battery innovation platform. A poster describing the Aurora battery assembly and cycling platform at Empa and results from cycling experiment performed within the integrated AiiDA-Aurora system. (Swiss Battery Days 2023)

More than open data: towards a FAIR data and simulation infrastructure with AiiDA and Materials Cloud. A presentation discussing how FAIR open research data can be obtained thanks to the PREMISE software tools, with specific focus on simulations but discussing also interoperability with experiments. (Workshop, FAIR and Open Data in NFFA-Europe Pilot and Beyond, Sep 2023)

Toward robust materials simulations with common workflow interfaces in AiiDA. A presentation of the work on designing a common API to perform simulations on materials, with over ten different codes. (Conference, PASC23, June 2023)

Open-research data repositories and reproducible workflows. A presentation and discussion of the requirements of ORD repositories, and how a tight integration with reproducible workflows can foster the creation and sharing of FAIR open research data. (Workshop, NCCR Network Ventures - Open Research Data events, June 2023)
Active outreach; project communication and dissemination activities.
Strategic collaboration with OpenEM (Establish project), joint events and standardisation.
Collaboration with S. Henne's ORD Explore project.
Involvement in NCCR Catalysis.
Involvement in Refuel.ch initiative.
Direct involvement in NCCR MARVEL.
SwissTwins project involvement.
Direct involvement in EU BIG-MAP and Battery2030+ projects.
Potential audience of 10,000+ users from several ELNs and WFMSs

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  REPORT OUTPUT FOCUS:
  - 15 standard output categories in "List of Outputs" table
  - Each category: quantity number, descriptions list, URLs list
  - Separate descriptions from URLs even when mixed in same cell
  - Academic collaborations vs Industrial partnerships (distinct categories)
  - Preserve all detailed descriptions and web addresses
